intro: Exocarpos dasystachyus, commonly known as the narrow-staminal wax apple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits with a waxy coating. The fruit is typically yellow or orange when ripe and contains several seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and fragrant blooms.
